body_html:
You need to update glibc or update Ubuntu to 14.04. It will work like charm.
…
On Apr 5, 2017 3:21 AM, "wilderfield" ***@***.***> wrote: I am facing similar problems. I am trying to run TensorFlow at work, on my RHEL 6.8 box. IT will not let us use package managers, and we cannot upgrade the bundled python, or gcc. I tried to get around this by installing Python 2.7, TensorFlow, and latest GCC locally on the box in /scratch I update LD_LIBRARY_PATH to point to my own copy of GCC shared libraries. It seems that tensorflow does not care about LD_LIBRARY_PATH, and it is searching in /lib64/libc.so.6 for GLIBC_2.16 — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#53 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AMRpkFCPPL_mPr7GvDYhuKxqapUY7ceaks5rsrtsgaJpZM4GfDu8> .

You need to update glibc or update Ubuntu to 14.04. It will work like charm.

On Apr 5, 2017 3:21 AM, "wilderfield" ***@***.***> wrote:
 I am facing similar problems. I am trying to run TensorFlow at work, on my
 RHEL 6.8 box. IT will not let us use package managers, and we cannot
 upgrade the bundled python, or gcc.
 I tried to get around this by installing Python 2.7, TensorFlow, and
 latest GCC locally on the box in /scratch
 I update LD_LIBRARY_PATH to point to my own copy of GCC shared libraries.
 It seems that tensorflow does not care about LD_LIBRARY_PATH, and it is
 searching in /lib64/libc.so.6 for GLIBC_2.16

body:
You need to update glibc or update Ubuntu to 14.04. It will work like charm.

On Apr 5, 2017 3:21 AM, "wilderfield" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I am facing similar problems. I am trying to run TensorFlow at work, on my
> RHEL 6.8 box. IT will not let us use package managers, and we cannot
> upgrade the bundled python, or gcc.
> I tried to get around this by installing Python 2.7, TensorFlow, and
> latest GCC locally on the box in /scratch
> I update LD_LIBRARY_PATH to point to my own copy of GCC shared libraries.
> It seems that tensorflow does not care about LD_LIBRARY_PATH, and it is
> searching in /lib64/libc.so.6 for GLIBC_2.16
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/53#issuecomment-291642438>,
> or mute the thread
